SMW Subobject for (1)High Alchemy value: 558Examine: A beautifully mounted Slayer gem.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Slayer ringUses infobox: ItemImage: File:Slayer ring.pngWeight: 0.010Value: 930Version anchor: (1)Release date: 6 January 2014Item ID: 11873

The Slayer ring (or Ring of slaying) can be used to teleport players to Slayer destinations and to contact Slayer masters.

Players can purchase Slayer rings from Slayer masters for 75 Slayer reward points each. Alternatively, they can purchase the Ring bling unlock for a one-time cost of 300 points, giving them the ability to craft slayer rings. Making a slayer ring requires level 75 Crafting. Players must bring an enchanted gem, a gold bar, and a ring mould to a furnace to make the ring. This yields 15 Crafting experience, the same as an ordinary gold ring.

Each ring has 8 charges when crafted. When they are all depleted, the ring crumbles, leaving an enchanted gem behind. Casting High Level Alchemy on a slayer ring produces 600 coins at full (8) charge, dropping by 6 coins per charge expended.

The slayer ring (eternal) is an upgraded version of the Slayer ring, made with an eternal gem instead of an enchanted gem. It has identical functions but provides unlimited teleport charges.

Teleports[edit | edit source]

The ring will teleport players to any of the locations displayed below. Each teleport consumes one charge from the ring. Similar to enchanted dragonstone jewellery, the slayer ring will allow players to teleport at up to level 30 Wilderness.

Location Destination Requirements Notes
Stronghold Slayer Cave Outside the cave, close to Nieve. None Close to a bank. Those who use NPC Contact may also find this teleport useful as they can teleport to Nieve to cancel/block their tasks with her, while using NPC Contact to contact other Slayer masters (such as Duradel) to try to get the task they want.
Slayer Tower Ground floor, just inside the entrance. Priest in Peril Can be used for easy access to Canifis.
Fremennik Slayer Dungeon Just inside the entrance. None Fourth closest teleport to a fairy ring (the quest point cape teleport being the closest, Salve Graveyard teleport (Arceuus Spellbook) second and the necklace of passage teleport to the Wizards' Tower being the third closest).
Tarn's Lair Empty room before the Terror dogs' chamber. Haunted Mine Can be used to skip a large portion of the Lair of Tarn Razorlor miniquest.
Dark Beasts Dark Beasts' chamber in the Mourner Tunnels. Mourning's End Part II Can be used to access the Mourner Tunnels without Mourner clothing.

Price per teleport[edit | edit source]

Because the high alchemy value is similar regardless of the number of charges, some of the cost of usage can be reclaimed by alching when one charge remains.

Item Ring Cost Cost Per Teleport Cost if Alching[n 1]
Slayer ring (8) 86 −11 39
  1. ^ Assuming a staff of fire or variant is used.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
27 September 2018
(update)

A "Check" option while the item is stored in the bank was added.

31 August 2017
(update)

Partially charged versions of the item could now be turned into bank placeholders.

6 March 2014
(update | poll)

The Slayer ring now offers a teleport to the Dark Beast tunnels, after Mourning's End Part II is complete.

23 January 2014
(update)

The Slayer Ring can now teleport players to the Stronghold Slayer Cave.

[[File:Slayer ring detail.png|left|140px]]
The '''Slayer ring''' (or '''Ring of slaying''') can be used to teleport players to [[Slayer]] destinations and to contact [[Slayer master]]s.

Players can purchase Slayer rings from Slayer masters for 75 [[Slayer reward point]]s each. Alternatively, they can purchase the ''Ring bling'' unlock for a one-time cost of 300 points, giving them the ability to craft slayer rings. Making a slayer ring requires level 75 [[Crafting]]. Players must bring an [[enchanted gem]], a [[gold bar]], and a [[ring mould]] to a [[furnace]] to make the ring. This yields 15 Crafting experience, the same as an ordinary [[gold ring]].

Each ring has 8 charges when crafted. When they are all depleted, the ring crumbles, leaving an enchanted gem behind. Casting [[High Level Alchemy]] on a slayer ring produces 600 coins at full (8) charge, dropping by 6 coins per charge expended.

The [[slayer ring (eternal)]] is an upgraded version of the Slayer ring, made with an [[eternal gem]] instead of an enchanted gem. It has identical functions but provides unlimited teleport charges.
